poem:
**Trade Winds**  

In the chambers where figures are shuffled,  
tariffs draw lines on whiskey's surface,  
Boeing's wings dipped in ink.  
Trump spins his globe, playing chess  
with bourbon pawns and aluminum rooks.  
Europe answers, pen poised:  
a hundred billion reasons  
to unfasten the sky, unclasp the cask,  
cross-stitched borders in the loom of loss.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "EU prepares €100bn no-deal plan to match Trump’s threat of 30% tariffs The EU has threatened to impose nearly €100bn (£87bn) worth of tariffs on US imports ranging from bourbon whiskey and Boeing aircraft in one fell swoop if Donald Trump does not agree a trade deal by the end of next week. The European Commission said on Wednesday it now planned to combine two previously prepared separate lists of US goods to be included". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: EU prepares €100bn no-deal plan to match Trump’s threat of 30% tariffs The EU has threatened to impose nearly €100bn (£87bn) worth of tariffs on US imports ranging from bourbon whiskey and Boeing aircraft in one fell swoop if Donald Trump does not agree a trade deal by the end of next week. The European Commission said on Wednesday it now planned to combine two previously prepared separate lists of US goods to be included
